job description:
Science is the foundation of our company. This is why it’s no surprise that our scientists are among the best in the world. We arm them with the resources, technology, and facilities they need to solve some of the world’s most complex health challenges. So, it’s no wonder that the most driven scientists in the world choose to do their life’s passion at Pfizer.

Role Summary

The Scientist will execute and lead in vivo efficacy studies using syngeneic, allograft, xenograft and PDX models that will support the preclinical development of Oncology lead molecules.

Role Responsibilities:
  • Comply with Pfizer policy, IACUC regulations, animal use protocols, experimental study design protocols, and standard operating procedures in place for conducting in vivo studies in the Pearl River vivarium.
  • Act as in vivo study lead, in which the candidate will ultimately be responsible for their assigned studies and must function as an integral member of the in vivo pharmacology team, conducting and/or overseeing all aspects of in vivo testing. Coordinating study activities with supervisor, project lead, and other members of the team will be essential.
  • In addition to demonstrating excellent in vivo technical skills required to generate robust and reproducible data, the candidate is accountable for day to day study oversight and will be expected to analyze the ongoing data in the context of the project objectives and provide critical recommendations to impact the design of subsequent studies.
  • Perform meticulous record keeping and generate scientific data which is incorporated into company reports and publications to support Pfizer pre-clinical cancer drug discovery and development.
  • Query molecular databases to identify experimental models that have desired genotypes, cancer target expression, or desired growth phenotypes.
  • Obtain a level of expertise on the target/program being supported in vivo by reading scientific literature, attending seminars etc.
  • Maintain familiarity with current and emerging technologies through reading and understanding scientific and technical literature enabling the use of new and improved procedures in the laboratory.
  • Present annual updates of studies/projects to the department meeting.
Qualifications:
  • BS 6+ years / MS 5+ years experience conducting in vivo research with rodents, tumor biology preferred.
  • Strong background in Biology, including expertise with animal models, tumor biology, tissue culture, physiology and pharmacology.
  • Ability to work closely with their manager to ensure precise execution and analysis of the in vivo study request and will provide input on the design of subsequent studies.
  • In addition to in vivo responsibilities, detailed data analysis and record keeping are required to support presentations and publications that are critical for the advancement of leads compounds in the Pfizer Oncology pipeline.
  • Demonstrate a high level of independence in performing all aspects of in vivo experiments (including patient-derived cancer models and cell line based cancer models), evaluating/ analyzing data, and drawing conclusions regarding experimental progress and results.
  • Possess excellent time-management skills and manage experiments in several projects concurrently.
  • Accommodate a flexible schedule to handle the unexpected deviations that occur in the course of managing in vivo studies. Schedule may include some holiday and weekend responsibilities to ensure optimization of in vivo pharmacology workflow.
  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills required to perform at a high level in a matrixed environment.
